---
id: client-get-recurring-payment-v-2
title: "[CLIENT IMPLEMENTATION] Get Recurring Payment"
description: "[CLIENT IMPLEMENTATION] Endpoint that our client must implement to receive Recurring Payment consultations. This endpoint will be used by the Receiver (PISP) to poll for the status of the Recurring Payment. This endpoint must behave exactly as the specified on the  [Open Banking Brazil Oficial Documentation](https://openfinancebrasil.atlassian.net/wiki/spaces/OF/pages/718406041/Informa+es+T+cnicas+-+SV+Pagamentos+Autom+ticos+-+v2.0.0-beta.2), except by the Authentication type, it must implement a mTLS or a SecretKey (the same mechanics used by our Webhooks)."

<Heading
  as={"h1"}
  className={"openapi__heading"}
  children={"[CLIENT IMPLEMENTATION] Get Recurring Payment"}
>
</Heading>

<MethodEndpoint
  method={"get"}
  path={"/client-implementation/pix/recurring-payments/v2/{recurringPaymentId}"}
  context={"endpoint"}
>
  
</MethodEndpoint>



[CLIENT IMPLEMENTATION] Endpoint that our client must implement to receive Recurring Payment consultations. This endpoint will be used by the Receiver (PISP) to poll for the status of the Recurring Payment. This endpoint must behave exactly as the specified on the  [Open Banking Brazil Oficial Documentation](https://openfinancebrasil.atlassian.net/wiki/spaces/OF/pages/718406041/Informa+es+T+cnicas+-+SV+Pagamentos+Autom+ticos+-+v2.0.0-beta.2), except by the Authentication type, it must implement a mTLS or a SecretKey (the same mechanics used by our Webhooks). 
The path can be parametrized by the client, it is just a suggestion, except by the fact that it must receive the RecurringPaymentId as a route or query parameter.

<Heading
  id={"request"}
  as={"h2"}
  className={"openapi-tabs__heading"}
  children={"Request"}
>
</Heading>

<ParamsDetails
  parameters={[{"name":"recurringPaymentId","description":"The Recurring Payment Id","schema":{"type":"string"},"in":"path","required":true}]}
>
  
</ParamsDetails>

<RequestSchema
  title={"Body"}
  body={undefined}
>
  
</RequestSchema>
